definition[0]: a small piece of equipment that you do not know the name for
definition[1]: used to refer to an imaginary product that a company might produce
example[0]: Company A produces 6,000 widgets a month at a unit price of $0.33.
definition[2]: a small piece of software used as part of a webpage, or on a mobile phone, that shows information or does other things in a way that is controlled by the user
definition[3]: any small piece of equipment, used especially to talk about something that you do not know the name of
example[1]: Rear-view mirrors are just the kind of widget that car makers could easily buy from cheap-labor plants in Asia.
definition[4]: an imaginary product that a company might produce
example[2]: If a retailer marks down a shelf of widgets to $ I.99 apiece from $4.99, it may sell more of them.
